name: Oh My Zsh
description: By default, you will be prompted to check for upgrades every few weeks.

name: PowerShell Core
description: PowerShell Core sends basic telemetry data to Microsoft and queries an online service to determine if a newer version is available.

telemetry.name: Usage data
telemetry.description: PowerShell sends basic telemetry data to Microsoft. This data allows us to better understand the environments where PowerShell is used and enables us to prioritize new features and fixes.

noop.name: Disable telemetry in PowerShell Core 6.0
noop.description: You can opt-out from telemetry by creating 'DELETE_ME_TO_DISABLE_CONSOLEHOST_TELEMETRY' file in the directory where 'pwsh' binary is installed.

telemetry.name: Update check
telemetry.description: PowerShell uses update notifications to alert users to the existence of updates to PowerShell. Once per day, PowerShell queries an online service to determine if a newer version is available.
